intro: Senecio streptanthifolius, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Senecio streptanthifolius is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with a deep root system that helps it withstand drought conditions.
